1.text: For there is a going forth for silver, and a place for gold they will purify it.

2.text: Iron shall be taken from the dust, and stone will pour out brass.

3.text: He set an end to darkness, and he searched out for all completeness: the stone of darkness and the shadow of death.

4.text: The torrent broke out from the sojourner; being forgotten of the foot, they were weak, they wandered from men.

5.text: The earth, from it will come forth bread, and under it was turned as fire.

6.text: Its stones the place of the sapphire, and dust gold to it.

7.text: A beaten path the birds knew not, and the vultureâ€™s eye scanned it not:

8.text: The sons of pride trod it not, and the lion passed not by upon it.

9.text: He stretched forth his hand upon the flint; he overturned the mountains from the roots.

10.text: He cut rivers in the rocks, and his eye saw every precious thing.

11.text: He bound the rivers from weeping, and he will bring forth the hidden thing to light.

12.text: And from whence shall wisdom be found? and where this place of understanding?

13.text: And man knew not its estimation, and it shall not be found in the land of the living.

14.text: The depth said, It is not in me: and the sea said, Not with me.

15.text: Shut up gold shall not be given for it, and silver shall not be weighed its price.

16.text: It shall not be weighed with gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, and the sapphire.

17.text: Gold and crystal shall not compare with it, and its exchange, vessels of pure gold.

18.text: High things, and crystal, shall not be remembered: and the drawing out of wisdom above pearls.

19.text: The topaz of Cush shall not compare with it; with pure gold it shall not be weighed.

20.text: And from whence shall wisdom come? and where this place of understanding?

21.text: And being hid from the eyes of all living, and covered from the birds of the heavens.

22.text: Destruction and death said, We heard its report with our ears:

23.text: God understood its way, and he knew its place.

24.text: For he will look to the ends of the earth, he will see under all the heavens;

25.text: To make the weight for the wind; and he weighed the waters by measure.

26.text: In his making a law for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the voices.

27.text: Then he saw, and he will recount it; he prepared it, and also he searched it out.

28.text: And he will say to man, Behold, the fear of Jehovah, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
